9B467C03DD42401AA82C42CC17A3A7C3.description:
identify strategies to demonstrate active and responsible citizenship in workplace, community
and global contexts

649A26C4BB7945BBA56A0C6A49BC37C7.description:

antiglobalization activism, legislation, agreements, consumer activism, corporate responsibility

4AAB85C961904BE5A2626E8E787DFB9D.description:
examine the ways in which globalization affects individuals and communities; e.g., migration,
technology, agricultural issues, pandemics, resource and contemporary issues

2F9DB140232C40B3887E55B469660CB4.description: examine the impacts of globalization on women; e.g., gender issues, labour issues

C148FBA569A24DBD9D23C35A35CCA6F6.description:
examine the impacts of globalization on children and youth; e.g., awareness of global issues,
employment issues, identity

78ECDB850C0D43718CDBE7AD0C262929.description: explore various understandings of quality of life

0255B85D15064D909D0881E252216245.description: accept the political, social and environmental responsibilities associated with global citizenship

How should I, as a citizen, respond to
globalization?

resource use, resource development agreements, environmental legislation

6E865984285C49E492145AEB49D062B8.description:
examine multiple perspectives on relationships among people, the land and globalization;
e.g., spirituality, stewardship, sustainability, resource development

DE6A8EB51844414A9AA297024261D655.description:
examine the political and economic challenges and opportunities of globalization; e.g., free
trade, foreign investment, economic growth, outsourcing

9DDFC0A7B4674A229D5FEC92C20AA86E.description:
examine various factors that contributed to the expansion of globalization since the Second
World War; e.g., international organizations, media and transportation technologies,

9CCCDABA0AAB419686C2E465FA106B6F.description:

6A7F00D4D48645B4846900002B224BF3.description:

0C9EEC4129A4471C98D03A8671EACEBD.description:
Does globalization contribute to
sustainable prosperity for all people?

4EB81CED0D614A7396789D5135190C58.description:
examine the legacies of historical globalization and imperialism that continue to influence
globalization

2AD62E8A5B7F4FB28D24503E4729498D.description:
examine attempts to address the consequences of imperialism in Canada; e.g., Royal
Commission on Aboriginal Peoples, contemporary examples

D0722F9AB83E419AAEB760765A8EAD75.description: examine the consequences for Aboriginals of a heritage of imperialism in Canada; e.g., Indian Act, consequences of residential schools, social impacts on indigenous peoples

B07DF29D9DAB45E7B572E0F7D11DF8D4.description:
examine multiple perspectives on the political, economic and social impacts of imperialism in

93E08A1299494DD0B6AA6B58FF8CD318.description:

imperialism, Eurocentrism

D1A90A455B5444FF9B7B4F10C7A396CC.description:
identify the effects of cultural contact between Europeans and indigenous peoples in Canada;
e.g., exchange of goods and technologies, depopulation, influences on government

B3931D53E41C40A184D10450E5621553.description:
recognize and appreciate various perspectives regarding the prevalence and impacts of

B0048AAD17924610BD32C0DAD246F760.description:

FADA8AFCEC1947879CF7285F88F1E114.description: accept social responsibilities associated with global citizenship

985735E832B84905AB8C9D4B765BF00B.description:

6DC591E2BD62484BA1324FCC1C173F7A.description:

consequences of historical globalization?

0D8C1A8401144B229A3D5D4D472A88F2.description:
